CHAPTER 155
Parks and Recreation Department
155.01   Establishment
155.02   Functions of the Parks and Recreation Board.
155.03   Membership of the Parks and Recreation Board.
155.04   School Board Liaison.
155.05   Vacancies.
155.06   Officers; rules and regulations.
155.07   Purchases; budget; report of expenditures.
155.08   Disbursement of funds.
155.09   Soliciting funds; arrangements for facilities.
155.10    Park hours; rules and regulations.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Authority to establish - see CHTR. Art.
VII, § 1
Bonds for recreational facilities - see Ohio R.C. 133.032, 755.17
Power to construct recreation centers - see Ohio R.C. 717.01
Tax levy - see Ohio R.C. 5705.19(H)
 
155.01 ESTABLISHMENT.
   Council hereby determines that the power to use, equip, operate and maintain
parks, playgrounds, playfields, gymnasiums, recreation centers and facilities
and a program for the development, encouragement and operation of a
recreational program and recreational activities of and for the City shall be
exercised by a Parks and Recreation Department and for such purposes hereby
establishes the Parks and Recreation Department. Such Department shall consist
of a Parks and Recreation Director who shall be the administrative head of the
Department and such other employees as are assigned to the Department by the
Mayor or Council. The Citizens Advisory Parks and Recreation Board shall be a
part of the Department, but shall be a citizen's advisory board to the Director
only.
(Ord. 2-1994. Passed 1-10-94.)
155.02 FUNCTIONS OF THE PARKS AND RECREATION BOARD.
   The Board shall give advice and counsel to the Director concerning:
    (a)    All parks, playgrounds, playfields, gymnasiums, recreation centers
and facilities owned, leased or operated by the City and of all buildings,
lands, property and equipment maintained for or devoted to recreational uses or
activities by or on behalf of the City.
   (b)    The operation of all recreational programs and activities conducted
or sponsored by the City including, but not limited to, the establishment of
rules and regulations for the conduct of such programs and activities for the
use of such facilities, for scheduling, for discipline and for each and every
other matter related thereto.
(Ord. 2-1994. Passed 1-10-94.)
155.03 MEMBERSHIP OF THE PARKS AND RECREATION BOARD.
   The Parks and Recreation Board shall consist of seven members, residents of
the City who shall be appointed by the Mayor with the concurrence of Council
for terms of three years each which shall next expire as follows: two terms
ending December 31, l990, three terms ending December 31, 1991 and two terms
ending December 31, 1992.
(Ord. 2-1994. Passed 1-10-94.)
155.04 SCHOOL BOARD LIAISON.
   The Board of Education of the Oregon City School District may designate a
liaison to
the Parks and Recreation Board who shall be entitled to participate in the
meetings of the
Board as though a member but who shall have no vote.
(Ord. 2-1994. Passed 1-10-94.)
155.05 VACANCIES.
    Vacancies in the membership of the Parks and Recreation Board occurring
otherwise than by expiration of terms shall be filled for the unexpired term
and in the same manner as original appointments.
(Ord. 2-1994. Passed 1-10-94.)
155.06 OFFICERS; RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   (a)   In accordance with the following and other applicable provisions of
the Codified Ordinances, the Charter and laws of the City, the Parks and
Recreation Director shall adopt rules and regulations to carry out the
principles hereinafter set forth.
   (b)   To improve the quality of life of all Oregon residents by providing or
causing to provide, a wide variety of leisure and cultural activities,
facilities and services that encourage positive community involvement. Utmost
consideration to be given to the emotional and physical well being of our
citizens. To lead, by example, in demonstrating fair play, honesty and
sportsmanship in every endeavor and to create community unity and pride.
   (c)    As to the participant, to deal justly and considerately; to respect
the participant's right to form his own judgment; to maintain the
confidentiality of personal information except where its disclosure is required
by law; to prevent all officials from commenting unprofessionally about a
participant's person or performance; to prevent the abuse of the position of a
member of the Board; to maintain and improve the quality of programs and
activities conducted or sponsored by the City.
 
   (d)    As to the people of the City, to insure the maximum practical
spectator
participation; to insure public notice of and input into actions of the
Director, to regularly
monitor programs to insure that appropriate standards are met, to maximize the
intended use of facilities under the supervision of the Parks and Recreation
Director; and to maintain the functional integrity of the program from
undesirable infringement.
 
   (e)   As to the Mayor and Council, to conduct all business of the Board in a
manner consistent with good parliamentary procedure, decorum and law; to avoid
conflicts of interest in the adoption and implementation of Board policy; to
maintain the integrity of confidential information; to maintain suitable
records of all official actions including, but not limited to denials of
participation, discipline and related matters; to insure prompt action on all
charges, inquiries and decisions.
(Ord. 2-1994. Passed 1-10-94.)
 
155.07 PURCHASES; BUDGET; REPORT OF EXPENDITURES.
   Within the limitation of funds appropriated for such purpose and the
provisions of the City Charter and ordinances, the Parks and Recreation
Director may purchase or otherwise provide such equipment, supplies and
facilities as it deems necessary or desirable to carry out the program and
maintain the recreational activities to be provided for, by or under the
jurisdiction of the Board.
   The Director shall submit to the Mayor a proposed budget and report of the
program and activities proposed to be carried on by it in the next succeeding
fiscal year and shall annually on or before December 31 make and file with
Council a complete report of its activities for the year last past showing
expenditures made and obligations incurred, together with any recommendations
deemed pertinent to the activities, facilities, business or personnel under its
jurisdiction.
(Ord. 2-1994. Passed 1-10-94.)
155.08 DISBURSEMENT OF FUNDS.
   Expenditures from funds appropriated by Council for property, equipment or
activities under the jurisdiction of the Parks and Recreation Director, after
certification by the Director to the Director of Finance of the amounts and
purposes thereof, shall be disbursed in the manner provided for disbursement of
municipal funds by the laws of the State and the City Charter and ordinances.
(Ord. 2-1994. Passed 1-10-94.)
155.09 SOLICITING FUNDS; ARRANGEMENTS FOR FACILITIES.
   The Parks and Recreation Director may solicit or receive gifts, donations or
bequests of money or property to be used for any activity or purpose within its
jurisdiction and, subject to the approval of Council, may enter into agreements
or arrangements for the participation, use, occupancy or loan of facilities and
equipment to be used or employed for programs and activities under its
jurisdiction.
(Ord.2-1994. Passed 1-10-94.)
155.10 PARK HOURS; RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Except for unusual and unforeseen emergencies, parks shall be open to
the public every day of the year. Hours of the opening and closing of the parks
shall be designated only when posted. All other aspects of the parks, use shall
also be promulgated from time to time by the Director of Parks and Recreation
and upon approval of the Mayor and notice to City Council. Park hours, rules
and regulations shall be published on the City of Oregon’s website.
 
   (b)   Any section of any park may be declared closed to the public by the
Director of Parks and Recreation at any time and for any interval of time,
either temporarily or at regular and started intervals, daily or otherwise, and
either entirely or merely to certain uses, as the Director finds reasonably
necessary.
(Ord. 031-2016. Passed 3-14-16.)
CHAPTER 157
Citizen's Advisory Health and Welfare Committee
157.01   Creation; officers; terms.
157.02   Duties.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Board of Health - see ADM. Ch.
153
 
157.01 CREATION; OFFICERS; TERMS.
   (a)    There is hereby created the Citizen's Advisory Health and Welfare
Committee of the City.
   (b)    The Committee shall consist of a chairman and such number of members
as shall be appointed by the Mayor with the consent of Council. The Committee
shall have the power to designate such other officers as it shall choose.
   (c)   The terms of all members shall be for a period of three years, unless
otherwise terminated or extended by Council.
(Res. 37-1965. Passed 4-12-65.)
 
157.02 DUTIES.
   The function of the Citizen's Advisory Health and Welfare Committee shall
be:
   (a)   To study and report to the Mayor and Council all matters affecting the
health and welfare of the residents of the City.
   (b)    To carry on in all respects the functions of the Oregon Emergency
Relief Committee, reporting from time to time to the Mayor all matters in this
connection.
   (c)    The Health and Welfare Committee shall seek its own methods of
financing its programs through donations from various clubs and organizations
within the City, and in this connection shall prepare its own budget and submit
reports to the Mayor in connection therewith.
(Res. 37-1965: Passed 4-12-65.)
CHAPTER 158
Tree Commission
158.01   Establishment; membership.
158.02   Powers and duties.
158.03   Organization; quorum; reports.
158.04   Purpose.
158.05   Definitions.
158.06   Authority of Commissioner of Streets.
158.07   Arborist’s license and bond.
158.08   Fastening materials to trees and shrubs.
158.09   Planting, trimming or removing trees.
158.10   Public utilities.
158.11   Tree protection during construction.
158.12   Moving of trees.
158.13   Trimming of trees.
158.14   Tree topping.
158.15   Interference with the Street Commissioner.
158.16   Appeal from order of Street Commissioner.
158.17   Trees in subdivisions.
158.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Authority to establish - see CHTR. Art.
VII, §1
Public meetings - see ADM. Ch.
107
Damage to trees - see GEN. OFF.
541.06
 
158.01 ESTABLISHMENT; MEMBERSHIP.
   (a)    There is hereby established a Tree Commission for the City which
shall be known as the Oregon Tree Commission. The Commission shall consist of
the following seven members: the Street Commissioner or his designee, an
elected official or an appointed City official, a representative from the
Oregon Growth Corporation and four residents of the City who shall be appointed
by the Mayor with the approval of Council.
   (b)   Of the initial appointments with the exception of the two City
designees, two terms shall expire on December 31, 1993, two terms shall expire
on December 31, 1994 and three terms shall expire on December 31, 1995.
Subsequent to the initial appointments, all appointments to the Commission
shall be for terms of three years. A vacancy occurring during the term of any
member of the Commission shall be filled for the unexpired term in the manner
authorized for an initial appointment.
   (c)    Members of the Commission shall serve without compensation.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.02 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   (a)   Members of the Tree Commission shall have the power to study,
investigate, plan, advise, report and recommend to the Mayor and Council, any
action, program, plan or legislation which the Commission finds or determines
to be necessary or advisable for the care, preservation, trimming, planting,
replanting, removal or disposition of trees and shrubs in public ways. The
Commission shall seek to educate and inform the residents about the proper care
and selection of trees and shrubs in whatever manner it considers best serves
the needs of City residents. The Commission shall inform the residents of the
City about the ordinances in force in the City pertaining to trees and shrubs.
   (b)   The Commission shall prepare lists of tree species to be approved for
the City. Only species included in the list may be planted as street trees
without written permission from the Street Commissioner. Others not on the list
shall have approval from the Street Commissioner. This list shall be reviewed
annually and updated when needed.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.03 ORGANIZATION; QUORUM; REPORTS.
   (a)    The Tree Commission shall choose its own officers, make its own rules
and regulations and keep a journal of its proceedings. Each member shall
exercise one vote. A majority of the members shall be a quorum for the
transaction of business.
   (b)   The Commission, when requested by the Mayor or Street Commissioner or
Council, shall consider, investigate, make findings, report and recommend upon
any special matter or question coming within this scope of its work.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.04 PURPOSE.
   It is the policy of the City to regulate and control planting, removal,
maintenance and protection of trees in the City right of way; to eliminate and
guard against dangerous conditions which may result in injury to persons using
the public areas of the City; to protect trees located in public areas from
undesirable and unsafe planting, removal, maintenance and protection practices;
and to guard all trees within the City against the spread of disease or pests.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.05 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)    "City" means the City of Oregon.
 
   (b)    "Tree lawn" means the parcel of land located between the curb and
sidewalk or City right of way where no sidewalk exists.
 
   (c)   "Public way" means all public streets, roads, boulevards, alleys and
sidewalks.
   (d)    "Public area" means all public ways, parks and other lands owned,
leased or controlled by the City.
   (e)   "Maintenance" and "protection" includes all operations of trimming,
pruning, spraying, injecting, fertilizing, treating, bracing, doing survey work
and cutting above or below the ground.
   (f)   "Street tree" or "tree" means any tree or shrub in a public place,
except where otherwise indicated.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.06 AUTHORITY OF COMMISSIONER OF STREETS.
   (a)    The Street Commissioner shall have jurisdiction and supervision over
all trees, other plants and grassy areas planted or growing in public places.
   (b)   The Commissioner shall have the authority and it shall be his duty to
plant, remove, maintain and protect trees and shrubs on all public areas as may
be necessary to ensure safety or preserve the symmetry and beauty of such
grounds.
   (c)   The Commissioner shall have the authority and it shall be his duty to
supervise all work done under a permit issued in accordance with the provisions
of this chapter.
   (d)   The Commissioner shall have the authority to affix reasonable
conditions to the granting of a permit under this chapter.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.07 ARBORIST'S LICENSE AND BOND.
   No person or firm shall engage in the business or occupation of pruning,
treating or removing trees within the City right of way or public lands without
first applying for and procuring a license. The license fee shall be set by the
City and shall be required of any public service endeavors. Before any license
is issued, each applicant shall first file evidence of possession as required
by the City. The license fee shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per year for
anyone who does it for hire, and excludes Toledo Edison and public utility
work. The license shall be filed in the Department of Building and Zoning
Inspection. All trees shall be trimmed and planted according to the National
Arborists Association standards.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.08 FASTENING MATERIALS TO TREES AND SHRUBS.
   No person shall fasten any sign, rope, wire or other material to, around or
through any public trees except in emergencies such as storms or accidents.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.09 PLANTING, TRIMMING OR REMOVING TREES.
   No person shall on any public area, including tree lawns, plant, trim or
remove a tree without filing a written request form with the Street
Commissioner. Should the Commissioner deny the issuance of a permit, an appeal
may be filed with the Tree Commission who may affirm or reverse the decision of
the Commissioner.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.10 PUBLIC UTILITIES.
   Public utility work affecting trees shall be limited to the actual
necessities of the services of the company and such work shall be done in a
neat and professional manner and according to accepted specifications and
standards.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.11 TREE PROTECTION DURING CONSTRUCTION.
   No person in charge of or responsible for the erection, alteration or
removal of any building or structure in the City shall permit a public tree in
the vicinity of such operation to stand without a good and sufficient guard or
protection to prevent possible injury. The quality of the guard or protection
shall be determined by the Street Commissioner.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.12 MOVING OF TREES.
   All moving of trees upon any public place in the City made necessary by the
moving of a building or structure or any other private enterprise shall be done
under the supervision and with the written permission of the Street
Commissioner and at the expense of the applicant or person seeking the removal
of such tree.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.13 TRIMMING TREES.
   The Street Commissioner shall keep all trees standing upon any public area
in the City, trimmed so that the branches of such trees projecting over any
public sidewalk or private driveway or into any public street beyond the curb
line do not conflict with the public welfare.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.14 TREE TOPPING.
   No person, firm or City department shall as a normal practice, top any
street tree, park tree or other tree on public areas. "Topping" means the
severe cutting back of limbs to stubs larger than three inches in diameter
within the tree's crown to such a degree as to remove the normal canopy and
disfigure the tree. Trees severally damaged by storms or other causes, or
certain trees under utility wires or other obstructions where other pruning
practices are impractical may be exempted from this section at the
determination of the Street Commissioner.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.15 INTERFERENCE WITH THE STREET COMMISSIONER.
   No person shall interfere with the Street Commissioner or his assistants
while engaged in or about the carrying out of the provisions of this chapter or
the doing of any of the work ordered by the Mayor or Council.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.16 APPEAL FROM ORDER OF STREET COMMISSIONER.
   A person who receives an order from the Street Commissioner and objects to
all or a part thereof, may, within fourteen days of receipt thereof, notify the
Commissioner in writing of his desire to appeal the order. The appeal is
presented to the Tree Commission who, by a majority vote, may affirm, reverse
or modify the order.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
 
158.17 TREES IN SUBDIVISIONS.
   Street trees are encouraged to be planted in all new subdivisions. Design
and placement of these trees may be obtained through the Street Commissioner.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
158.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be assessed for the
cost of a tree recommended by the Tree Commission and the cost shall be
recovered on the following year's property taxes. Each tree affected by
noncompliance with this chapter shall constitute a separate violation.
(Ord. 115-1992. Passed 9-14-92.)
CHAPTER 165
Compensation
   EDITOR'S NOTE: Compensatory and fringe benefit provisions are no longer
included within the Codified Ordinances since they are subject to frequent
change and covered in part by collective bargaining agreements.
